questions.question: What is BGP (Border Gateway Protocol)?
questions.explanation: BGP: connects autonomous systems. Scalability: internet backbone. Path: policy-based. Version: BGPv4. Attributes: AS_PATH, NEXT_HOP. Complexity: sophisticated algorithms.

questions.question: What is an autonomous system (AS)?
questions.explanation: AS: collection of routers. Control: single admin. ASN: autonomous system number. BGP: exchanges routes. Example: ISP network. Importance: internet structure.

questions.question: What is OSPF (Open Shortest Path First)?
questions.explanation: OSPF: link-state routing. Algorithm: Dijkstra. Convergence: fast. Scalability: moderate. Areas: can subdivide. Importance: enterprise routing.

questions.question: What is RIP (Routing Information Protocol)?
questions.explanation: RIP: oldest routing protocol. Metric: hop count. Limit: maximum 15 hops. Update: periodic. Disadvantage: slow convergence. Modern: rarely used. Importance: historical.

questions.question: What is a routing table?
questions.explanation: Table: destination, gateway, metric, flags. Lookup: find best match. Static: manually configured. Dynamic: automatically updated. Query: route command. Importance: packet forwarding.

questions.question: What is network address aggregation?
questions.explanation: Aggregation: reduce routing entries. Method: group addresses. Benefit: smaller routing tables. Complexity: calculation needed. CIDR: enables aggregation. Importance: scalability.

questions.question: What is DiffServ?
questions.explanation: DiffServ: mark packets for priority. DSCP: field marks priority. Classes: multiple service levels. Scalability: domain-based. vs IntServ: resource reservation. Application: VoIP, video.

questions.question: What is traffic shaping?
questions.explanation: Shaping: control data rate. Bucket: token/leaky bucket algorithm. Purpose: prevent congestion. Implementation: edge routers. Benefit: predictable service. vs Policing: discard excess.

questions.question: What is packet filtering?
questions.explanation: Filtering: stateless inspection. Rules: source, destination, port, protocol. Application: firewalls. Limitation: basic security. Modern: stateful, deep inspection. Importance: first defense.

questions.question: What is stateful inspection?
questions.explanation: Inspection: maintain state table. Memory: connection info stored. Security: better than stateless. Complexity: more processing. Application: modern firewalls. Benefit: security improvement.
